column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////I'll tell you point blank
column2: Malnati's is not my favorite chicago style deep dish pizza joint. That having been said
column3: their sauce is pretty stellar! My only complaint would be that for "deep dish pizza
column4: it 1.) isn't very deep and 2.) is not particularly dense. It is authentic, but authentic chicago deep dish pizza is apparently not my favorite deep dish pizza. Do go, you'll enjoy it. A lot of the restaurants are situated in converted houses. Service is quick, you don't wait a million years for your pie, and you can buy small frozen pizzas on your way out.
